Activity: Wake up, have coffee, mentally review the planned structure for data feed integration.
Check emails, address immediate concerns. Review the data feed specifications and the feedback from data scientists.
Incorporate feedback from @dsde-1 and @dsde-2 into the data feed specifications. Refine the document for clarity and completeness. Add a section on data validation and error handling.

Begin outlining the architecture for the data ingestion layer. Consider using a message queue (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ) to decouple data producers from consumers. Sketch out the data transformation and enrichment processes.

Research different database technologies suitable for storing market data. Evaluate time-series databases (e.g., InfluxDB, TimescaleDB) and NoSQL databases (e.g., Cassandra, MongoDB). Consider performance, scalability, and cost.
Update the technology infrastructure plan with the chosen database technology and the rationale behind the decision. Document the data storage schema and indexing strategies.
Contact @sdev-1 and @sdev-2 to discuss the data ingestion layer architecture and the database technology selection. Gather their feedback on implementation challenges and potential optimizations.
End of workday. Mentally review the day's data architecture choices.
